function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Digital COVID-19 contact tracing may compromise equality, privacy, and fairness.","Impact":"Potential violation of privacy, discrimination, and unfair treatment of individuals.","Mitigation":"Incorporating ethical principles such as necessity, proportionality, scientific validity, and time-bound limitations into the design and implementation of contact tracing apps.","Technologies":"Ethical digital interventions, privacy protection technologies, and fairness algorithms.","People":"Public, individuals with vulnerable health records, social interaction, and movement.","Owner":"Developers, government agencies, and deployers of COVID-19 contact tracing apps."},{"Description":"Use of robotics in COVID-19 response introduces new technology risks.","Impact":"Potential issues related to the control system, privacy concerns, and ethical implications.","Mitigation":"Implementation of robust control methodologies, validation in real-time digital simulators, and consideration of ethical principles in the design and deployment of robotics technology for COVID-19 response.","Technologies":"Fuzzy logic control, sliding mode control, robotics technologies.","People":"Patients, medical personnel, public.","Owner":"Research and development teams, government agencies, and healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"The usage of mobile apps for COVID-19 contact tracing presents privacy and trade-off considerations.","Impact":"Potential privacy breaches and trade-offs between providing services and protecting privacy.","Mitigation":"Incorporating privacy-preserving technologies, ethical design considerations, and trade-off analysis into the development of mobile contact tracing apps.","Technologies":"Privacy-preserving mobile app technologies, ethical design frameworks, privacy trade-off analysis tools.","People":"Public, individuals using the app, developers.","Owner":"Developers, government agencies, and stakeholders involved in app deployment."}]}
